job_description: Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview Join us as an Advisor on our Business Operations team in Romania to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. This role plays an integral part of the Financial Business Operations team, responsible for a wide range of Secureworks Operations duties such as monthly review and validation of key team metrics, process improvement and implementation as well as back-up the Quality Assurance process and Business Operations Sr. Manager as needed. Candidate will be expected to follow SOX Control guidelines to ensure that financial and operating processes are followed. Principle Accountabilities Works with business users to define and analyze problems Maintains and manages systems key to the function that is supported Considers the implications of business solutions to the current and future environment Devises or modifies procedures to solve problems considering resources, time and form of desired results Acts as subject-matter expert on business processes of assigned area Interfaces with business areas to provide solutions and tools to build and strengthen business processes Identifies the business opportunities to deliver values through Knowledge Management at program and business unit level Designs, develops, implements, and maintains knowledge basis Ensures that the internal accounting reporting requirements of the company are met Maintains current knowledge of relevant Knowledge Management and technologies Advises and consults on financial and/or accounting issues involving business activities for a business unit to ensure proper compliance with laws and GAAP Completes all required month-end close activities including reconciliations, analysis and leadership reporting Assists internal and/or external audit process as required Works with relevant non-Accounting personnel in reviewing contracts to ensure adherence to company policies and the necessary Accounting treatment Key Responsibilities Project and Backlog Management: Set up projects correctly in project management system, manage revenue recognition to meet Accounting GAAP standards, monitor projects to ensure project information is correct Billing: Evaluate contracts to determine billing, set up billing in project management system, release billing events, ensure client billing is correct, work with internal clients to answer billing questions and ensure clients receive their required information on invoices Reporting: Produce reporting for key metrics, on a scheduled or ad hoc basis, in project management system and billing system to ensure Accounting and Business processes are being followed Project Administration Tickets: Process and complete Support Request tickets as documented, ensuring to escalate up if the need arises in an acceptable timeframe Support/Back-up Business Operations team members with other responsibilities as the need arises Auditing: Conduct internal team process audits to ensure SOX Controls are being met Process Improvement: Collaborate with internal teams to drive change that will assist in the scaling of operations through automation, work assessment and process improvement Process Documentation: Prepare and maintain team process manuals, procedures, work instructions, templates, and training materials Training: Provide training to associates on processes; demonstrate subject matter expertise to assist business partners including, but not limited to Sales, Operations and Finance Build and develop relationships with key stakeholders and customers in order to achieve business goals Other Ad Hoc Needs: Support Security Risk Consulting team and Business Operations team for ad hoc reporting, tracking, and internal projects Essential Requirements 5+ years of related experience in a professional role with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3+ years with a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent experience Proficient Excel user Previous experience in financial area such as billing, contract management, reporting, and some analytical work Strong English communication skills, written and verbal Preferred Skills Proficient in MS office applications such as but not limited to Excel, Word, PowerPoint Strong problem-solving skills with an aptitude for critical thinking and issue resolution Solid handle on Process Documentation, Delivery Methodologies and Project Management Ability to work in a team environment but also take general direction and then execute independently Desirable Requirements Experience with Workday or other financial ERP systems Experience
